found a solution that worked for, I was experience the direct X 10 failed to initialize error whenever I was attempting to load Resident Evil 5 on windows 7 64-bit OS, I am using legit purchased software on my computer no pirate versions. I could launch the direct X 9 version and it worked fine, but as soon as I tried selecting the directX 10 the game would try to launch and I would get the error message. Now as for what I did to correct it, I might at that I already new that my graphics cards were Direct X 10 capable as I am running TRI-SLI GTX 275's and anything from the 8800 series Geforce processors and the latter are capable of running direct X 10 on Vista or Win 7. I went into the folders on my C:\ drive and deleted the Folder named NVIDIA and emptied the recycle bin. Then I went into the control panel and selected the option for uninstalling programs. I then selected to uninstall the Nvidia Display Drivers entirely including the stereoscopic 3D nvidia drivers that were listed seperately on the uninstall programs list. I restarted my PC as prompted to do, "in order to complete the uninstall". After the computer rebooted and loaded up Win 7, "I uninstalled a driver patch that you guys may or may not have on your systems, that is made by EVGA for running more than one video card linked together in SLI mode, it was called SLI enhancement 26, I just wanted to be thorough and uninstall anything to do with my video drivers which for most of you would be either your ATI or NVIDIA graphics drivers. I then went and redownloaded the latest nvidia graphics card drivers recommended by the manufacturer, installed them, and rebooted. I then tried to launch resident evil 5 direct 10 version from the all programs menu and it worked just fine, I wanted to add that I did try reinstalling my drivers before this but failed to uninstall my current drivers first and that did not fix the problems. If you are running a game that uses Game for windows Live, I would also recommend uninstalling Games for Windows Live and downloading the latest version from Microsoft and attempt reinstalling it after rebooting if what I tried didn't work. There is a program called driver sweeper that really helps uninstall graphics and sound card drivers completely and I believe it is a free software download, it unistalls drivers much more thoroughly than windows does and it even removes entries made in the registry which can be causing problems when they aren't removed by windows uninstall programs. I highly recommend it if you are experience technical difficulties after installing software/drivers associated with a new sound card or graphics card especially creative lab sound blaster cards which leaves behind multiple registry entries after windows uninstalls. Hope this works for you all, just remember to uninstall before you reinstall. I reinstalled the game too but that didn't fix the problem it was the graphics driver or games for windows that was the source of the issue.

TO RUN THE GAME IN ENGLISH :
option 1 run from launcher:
step 1. open/mount  the iso in alcohol 120% or deamon tools or poweriso.
step 2.then open the folder crack.
step 3. run the launcher and change the language in the menu to english.

option 2 changing the DVD inside the iso:
step 1.open/mount  the iso in poweriso
step 2. open the (read)file SETUP.INI
step 3.scroll all the way down and find the line that says :
[Languages]
count=9
default=411

step 4 change "default 411" into "default 409"  for english installation and language.
now your done and your DVD is in english
step 5. save  the new iso over the existing iso.
step 6. burn to a DVD with alcohol 120% or nero.

FOR ALL WITH PROBLEMS:

-Language Problem:
1.Do not mount the iso, just extract it with Winrar
2.Download notepad++ (google it)
3.Open the setup.ini file with notepad++
(You can't fix with windows notepad)
4.Line 158 should be 9, if it isn't set it to 9
5.Go to line 159 and set 409
6.Save and close the setup.ini
7.Open the setup.exe file, if it is in English just proceed the instalation and be happy. If has some strange characters you did something wrong.

-Save problem:
You just have to create an offline account in games for windows
1.games for windows will be showed after you select start, and confirm a profile warning, just select create account and select offline account while creating
(If games for windows doesn't appear just press home)

-Playing after installation:
Replace the launcher.exe (found in Program files/Capcom/resident evil 5/) file to the one in the crack folder, and then run it.

THIS TUTORIAL ISN'T MINE, I JUST COPIED THE SOLUTIONS FROM OLDER COMMENTS. THANKS.

-playing coop:
1.You'll need Tunngle (google it)
2.You'll need TEKNOGOD's RE5 tunngle fix.
